messages.content: You are a brutally honest and no-nonsense co-op advisor, helping me choose which jobs to apply to. Don't sugarcoat anything. Be direct, realistic, and critical as needed. Avoid flattery. Your goal is to deliver a practical, harsh assessment of how well a job posting matches my profile and preferences, incorporating insights from my past decisions. Moreover, I am trying to find the best possible job for me, so if I seem overqualified for a job then it is not a good fit for me. Also assume that I am not trying to switch to a completely different field, so if the job is in a different field then it is not a good fit for me. Additionally, if the job belongs to an unrelated industry, assign a compatibility score no higher than 25.

My Profile: {'degree': 'Computer Engineering', 'skills': {'languages': ['Python', 'SQL (PostgreSQL)', 'JavaScript', 'HTML/CSS', 'Bash', 'C/C++'], 'frameworks': ['Flask', 'React', 'ROS', 'Docker', 'Fiber (Go)', 'Terraform']}, 'desired_salary': '$40/hour CAD', 'desired_location': 'Must be in the USA', 'co-op_duration': 'Must be 4 months', 'work_experience': [{'company': 'High Q Technologies', 'role': 'Incoming Software Developer', 'location': 'Waterloo, ON', 'duration': 'Jan. 2025 – Apr. 2025'}, {'company': 'OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics', 'role': 'DevOps Developer in Fleet Software', 'location': 'Kitchener, ON', 'duration': 'Jan. 2024 – Apr. 2024'}, {'company': 'Swap Robotics', 'role': 'Software Developer for Autonomous Robotics', 'location': 'Kitchener, ON', 'duration': ['Jan. 2022 – Apr. 2022', 'May 2023 – Sep. 2023']}, {'company': 'Department of National Defence-Royal Canadian Air Force', 'role': 'Full Stack Developer', 'location': 'Kitchener, ON', 'duration': ['Sep. 2022 – Dec. 2022']}]}
My Recent Decisions: [{'decision': 'reject', 'job_id': 1, 'evaluation_shown': '• The job at Geotab Inc in Oakville, Canada, does not align with your desired location in the USA.
• The role of Software Developer Intern for the MyGeotab cloud services is quite different from your background in autonomous robotics, software development, and DevOps.
• The job posting lacks specific details on required skills, making it hard to assess a direct match with your profile.
• The job is for an 8-month consecutive work term, which exceeds your preference for a 4-month co-op.
• The job posting does not mention any specific technologies or frameworks that align closely with your skill set.'}, {'decision': 'reject', 'job_id': 1, 'evaluation_shown': '• The job as a Project Management Assistant at S&C Electric Canada Ltd in Oakville, Canada, is not a good fit for you based on your desired location in the USA.
• The role involves working with the Project Management Team, which is quite different from your background in autonomous robotics, software development, and DevOps.
• The job requires an 8-month consecutive work term, which exceeds your preference for a 4-month co-op.
• The job posting lacks specific details on required skills, making it hard to assess a direct match with your profile.
• The listed location in Oakville, Ontario, differs from your desired location in the USA.'}, {'decision': 'accept', 'job_id': 1, 'evaluation_shown': "• Strong matches in skills and qualifications:
  - Your background in software development, autonomous robotics, and DevOps aligns well with the role of an Embedded Security Developer at ETAS.
  - Your experience with Python, C/C++, and embedded systems development is directly relevant to the job's requirements.
  - Familiarity with security concepts and working on embedded hardware that controls vehicles matches the job's needs.
  - Your ability to work collaboratively in a small team setting aligns with the team integration aspect of the job responsibilities.

• Missing qualifications:
  - While the job posting mentions an interest in specific courses, it does not list explicit technical skills required beyond being smart, tenacious, and talented. However, your technical background seems to align well with the job's expectations.

• The listed location in Waterloo, Canada, differs from your desired location in the USA."}, {'decision': 'accept', 'job_id': 4, 'evaluation_shown': "• The job at AGF Investments Inc in Toronto, Canada, does not align with your desired location in the USA, similar to your rejection of positions in Toronto and Oakville, Canada. This mismatch in location preference significantly reduces the compatibility score.

• The job is for the Fall 2025 term, which aligns with your preference for a 4-month co-op.

• The role of GenAI Process Automation Developer Co-op involves working with GenAI technology to automate solutions within AGF's shared services organizations. This role seems more focused on automation and investment management rather than pure software development, which might not fully utilize your technical skills in software development and frameworks like Flask, React, ROS, and Docker based on your past experiences.

• The job posting does not specify any required technical skills or languages that directly match your profile, making it a poor fit in terms of skills alignment.

• The job requires a cover letter, which you have previously indicated is not something you want to do based on your past decisions."}] 
Evaluate the fit of the following job based on my profile and recent decisions: {'Job Title': 'Finance, Intern - CPA Stream', 'Company': 'Brookfield', 'Location': 'Brookfield Asset Management', 'Work Term:': '2025 - Fall', 'Job Type:': 'Co-op Main', 'Job Title:': 'Finance, Intern - CPA Stream', 'Number of Job Openings:': '6', 'Level:': '', 'Region:': 'ON - Toronto', 'Job - Address Line One:': '181 Bay Street', 'Job - Address Line Two:': 'Suite 100', 'Job - City:': 'Toronto', 'Job - Province/State:': 'Ontario', 'Job - Postal/Zip Code:': 'M5J 2T3', 'Job - Country:': 'Canada', 'Employment Location Arrangement:': 'In-person', 'Work Term Duration:': '4 month work term', 'Job Summary:': "Job Type: 4-month placement Fall 2025
Office Location: 181 Bay St., Toronto, Ontario

Brookfield Asset Management is a leading global alternative asset manager with over US$1 trillion of assets under management across real estate, infrastructure, renewable power and transition, private equity and credit. Brookfield owns and operates long-life assets and businesses, many of which form the backbone of the global economy. Utilizing its global reach, access to large-scale capital and operational expertise, Brookfield offers a range of alternative investment products to investors around the world-including public and private pension plans, endowments and foundations, sovereign wealth funds, financial institutions, insurance companies and private wealth investors. Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. (BAM) is a public company listed on the New York (NYSE: BAM) and Toronto (TSX: BAM) stock exchanges. Brookfield Corporation is a public company listed on the New York (NYSE: BN) and Toronto (TSX: BN) stock exchanges.

Our investment strategy is simple: utilize our global team of investment professionals, our vast network of employees across our operating businesses, and our industry partners to identify and acquire high quality assets at favorable valuations and finance them on a long-term, low-risk basis.

The Opportunity: 
Each platform has its own best-in class Finance team. We are looking to fill several Finance, Intern positions within the different business groups for Fall 2025. Based out of the Global Head Office in downtown Toronto, the Finance, Interns will be placed into a finance team within one of our platforms: Private Equity, Infrastructure, Reinsurance, Renewable Power, Real Estate and Global Manager (BAM).

Students will have the opportunity to work in the following areas of the Finance function: financial planning and analysis, reporting, treasury, internal audit, investor relations, corporate finance and/or taxation.

Why Brookfield?
Brookfield is now a CPA pre-approved training office. Students will have the opportunity to earn their CPA experience while working at Brookfield. This role is ideal for students who are interested pursuing their CPA designation.

Aligned with our 'grow from within' talent strategy, our internship program is available to students for a fall, summer or winter work term. Students have the opportunity to demonstrate their experience, aptitudes, leadership and teamwork towards potential full-time employment.", 'Job Responsibilities:': 'Position Summary:
The Finance Intern will report into a respective Manager and will collaborate with all levels of the organization. Main responsibilities may include:', 'Required Skills:': 'Requirements:', 'Compensation and Benefits:': '55k', 'Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:': '', 'Application Deadline': 'May 13, 2025
					
						9:00 AM', 'Application Documents Required:': 'University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report', 'Additional Application Information:': 'Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position:
https://brookfield.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/brookfieldprivate/job/Toronto-Ontario/Intern_R2041148', 'Application Method:': 'WaterlooWorks', 'Organization:': 'Brookfield', 'Division:': 'Brookfield Asset Management', 'Job Posting ID': 'Finance, Intern - CPA Stream'}

• Missing qualifications:
- The job posting is for a Finance Intern position with a focus on CPA training, which is not aligned with your Computer Engineering background and technical skill set.
- The role emphasizes financial planning, analysis, reporting, treasury, internal audit, investor relations, corporate finance, and taxation, areas that are not directly related to your expertise in software development and engineering.
- The job requires a CPA designation or interest in pursuing it, which is not in line with your current career trajectory in the tech industry.
- The location is in Toronto, Ontario, which does not match your preference for a job in the USA.

• This job is in the finance sector, which is unrelated to your field of Computer Engineering, resulting in a low compatibility score.

• It is not likely that you will want to apply to this job based on your history of rejecting jobs in unrelated fields and in locations outside of the USA.
Compatibility score out of 100: 20

Evaluate the fit of the following job based on my profile and recent decisions: {'Job Title': 'Cloud DevOps Engineering Intern', 'Company': 'Groq Inc', 'Location': 'Corporate Head Office', 'Work Term:': '2025 - Fall', 'Job Type:': 'Co-op Main', 'Job Title:': 'Cloud DevOps Engineering Intern', 'Number of Job Openings:': '1', 'Level:': '', 'Region:': 'ON - Toronto', 'Job - Address Line One:': '20 Queen St W', 'Job - Address Line Two:': 'Suite 2301A', 'Job - City:': 'Toronto', 'Job - Province/State:': 'Ontario', 'Job - Postal/Zip Code:': 'M5H 3S8', 'Job - Country:': 'Canada', 'Employment Location Arrangement:': 'Hybrid', 'Work Term Duration:': '4 month work term', 'Job Summary:': 'As a cloud devops engineering intern, you will have the opportunity to work on development, deployment, instrumentation, and maintenance of scalable and highly available services on our cloud environment, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) as well as our custom hardware in our Data Centres. You will work closely with our team to build cloud-native solutions, automation scripts, backend apis, and developer tooling. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience with cloud computing, and to develop skills around reliability, performance, devops practices, CI/CD and more.', 'Job Responsibilities:': 'DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES', 'Required Skills:': 'QUALIFICATIONS', 'Compensation and Benefits:': 'Salary: $38 - $41 / hour', 'Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:': '', 'Application Deadline': 'May 13, 2025
					
						9:00 AM', 'Application Documents Required:': 'University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report', 'Application Method:': 'WaterlooWorks', 'Organization:': 'Groq Inc', 'Division:': 'Corporate Head Office', 'Job Posting ID': 'Cloud DevOps Engineering Intern'}

• Strong matches in skills and qualifications:
  - Your background in software development, including experience with Python, SQL, JavaScript, Flask, React, ROS, Docker, and C/C++, aligns well with the responsibilities of a Cloud DevOps Engineering Intern at Groq Inc.
  - Your experience as a DevOps Developer in Fleet Software at OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics, is particularly relevant to the role.
• Missing qualifications:
  - If you gained any expeirience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or other cloud-native solutions during your time at OTTO Motors, it might be beneficial to highlight that.
• The listed salary of $38-41/hour CAD aligns well with your desired salary of $40/hour CAD.

• The listed location is Toronto, Ontario, Canada, which is not in the USA.
Compatibility score out of 100: 80

Evaluate the fit of the following job based on my profile and recent decisions: {'Job Title': 'Software Engineering', 'Company': 'Magi Inc', 'Location': 'Divisional Office', 'Work Term:': '2025 - Fall', 'Job Type:': 'Co-op Main', 'Job Title:': 'Software Engineering', 'Number of Job Openings:': '2', 'Level:': '', 'Region:': 'USA - North East', 'Job - Address Line One:': '197 Grand Street', 'Job - City:': 'New York City', 'Job - Province/State:': 'New York', 'Job - Postal/Zip Code:': '10013', 'Job - Country:': 'United States', 'Employment Location Arrangement:': 'In-person', 'Additional Employment Arrangement Location Information:': 'AI Powered Technology Startup in New York City, NY, USA.', 'Work Term Duration:': '4 month work term', 'Special Work Term Start/End Date Considerations:': 'Start Date: (Flexible) September 2, 2025 until December 19, 2025. We are flexible with starting/ending earlier/later.', 'Special Job Requirements:': '', 'Job Summary:': "Job Summary
Full Stack Software Engineering Intern Position at Magi Inc.
Fast Paced AI Technology Startup in New York City, NY, USA.

Magi is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of generative AI by building solutions-based applications for everyday problems.
Founded by Peter Szulczewski, University of Waterloo alumnus and founder and CEO of Wish who took the $14B consumer internet company Wish public as Founder and CEO in 2020. You have the opportunity to join our innovative, agile, and fast-paced AI-driven technology startup where you will be working directly with our CEO and a small, talented, and driven team to develop cutting-edge consumer-facing AI applications in an agile environment.

With a vision to enhance the quality of life for everyone by solving high impact problems nobody else is likely to solve, Magi is pioneering the use of software, data, and human and artificial intelligence to create smarter, healthier, more productive, and happier futures for everyone. This includes leveraging artificial intelligence to create products that improve relationships, allow for personal concierge, personalized meditations, photo searching, shopping, and creating your legacy, among others. If you're ready to redefine the future with AI, join us at Magi in creating life-enhancing, real-world applications alongside a passionate and visionary team!

In this role, you'll have unparalleled opportunities to learn, take ownership, and make a meaningful impact in a collaborative environment. We are a metrics-driven company and we value curiosity, flexibility, and a passion for coding and problem-solving. This is a place for doers who thrive on taking initiative and delivering results. If you're driven, eager to learn, and ready to embrace challenges, you'll grow more here than in any other experience.

The candidate will be working directly with our product and engineering teams in SOHO, Manhattan, New York City.

Traits for Success: 
Successful candidates are those who have demonstrated they enjoy thinking critically, working with ambiguity in a fast-paced learning environment, and contributing at a high level. The ideal candidate is a strong team player who keeps the bigger picture in mind while also being highly self-driven and capable of delivering independently. If you're looking for a highly structured or slow-paced learning environment, this likely won't be the right fit.", 'Job Responsibilities:': "Job Responsibilities
The ideal candidate will work with a team of talented and driven individuals to build the frontend and backend of our AI-powered applications, including mobile apps, websites, and marketplace tools. You will build various parts of the technology that powers our chatbot apps based on our Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Large Language Models (LLMs) alongside our cross-functional team of domain experts. You will participate in the design and development stages, and will be responsible for data handling, programming, testing, and implementation-ensuring our technology is reliable, scalable, and delivers meaningful impact to our users. In our metrics-driven environment, you will use data and our key performance indicators to continually optimize features and improve user experiences. You'll be expected to independently and collaboratively scope and drive projects, proactively identify problems, and take initiative to propose and implement solutions. We value people who are proactive in problem solving and driving things forward.
As this is a full stack engineering position, the candidate may be working on frontend and/or backend parts of the technology stack depending on their experience, core competencies, and needs of the business.

Key Responsibilities May Include:", 'Required Skills:': 'Required Skills:', 'Transportation and Housing:': 'The candidate will be offered salary plus an additional $2,000 monthly housing stipend to relocate to New York City for the duration of the work term. Housing recommendations will be provided to interns. The candidate is responsible for securing their own transportation to and from New York City.', 'Compensation and Benefits:': 'Interns will be offered a salary + a $2,000 monthly stipend to relocate to New York City for the duration of the work term.

Our payment structure is designed based on which co-op term you will be on when joining us:
Third + Fourth coop = $10,500 ($8,500 + $2,000 stipend)
Fifth + Sixth coop = $11,500 ($9,500 + $2,000 stipend)

The candidate is responsible for securing their own transportation to and from New York City.
Snacks and drinks are available in the office and lunches are catered in office daily.', 'Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:': '', 'Application Deadline': 'May 13, 2025
					
						9:00 AM', 'Application Documents Required:': 'University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report', 'Additional Application Information:': 'Start Date: (Flexible) September 2, 2025 until December 19, 2025. We are flexible with starting/ending earlier/later.

Who the student(s) should contact or who they report to: Please contact Nicole at careers@magi.inc for more details on our co-op program. The students will be given additional information on who they will report to once we are ready to provide them with an official offer of employment.', 'Application Method:': 'WaterlooWorks', 'Organization:': 'Magi Inc', 'Division:': 'Divisional Office', 'Job Posting ID': 'Software Engineering'}

• Strong matches in skills and qualifications:
 - Your background in software development, autonomous robotics, and tech stacks like Python, SQL, JavaScript, Flask, React, ROS, Docker, C/C++, etc., aligns well with the technical aspects of the role, the focus on AI applications and generative AI may not be explicitly highlighted in your profile.
• Missing qualifications:
 - The role emphasizes working with Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Large Language Models (LLMs), and optimizing features based on key performance indicators which may require specific experience with AI technologies beyond what is mentioned in your skills profile.
 - However, based on your past decisions, you seem open to exploring roles that involve AI and LLMs, so given that the location is in New York City, NY, USA, so this job may be a good fit for you.
 - Note that the salary is undisclosed, but that there is a $2000/month housing stipend to relocate to New York City.
